task.summary: Default task

Update Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks version and store user data
The Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks version has been updated in the Resource.designer.cs file from "13.2.1.111" to "13.2.2.120". Addition of Linq library and important user data like UserID is now being stored in CreateAccountViewModel.cs, which will be used later to customize the user experience. Also added functionality to calculate and display the Basal Metabolic Rate (BMR) in the DashboardPage.xaml.cs file.

Refactor FoodCategoryViewModel for clarity and encapsulation
The FoodCategoryViewModel class has been sealed and variables have been renamed to improve readability and adhere to naming conventions. The access modifiers for these variables and the OnPropertyChanged() method were also adjusted to ensure proper encapsulation and adhere to best practices. The function parameters were updated as well to provide more accurate descriptions.

Update food item properties and data bindings
The changes in this commit consist of a variable name change from FoodName to Food_Name, and an update to the FoodCategoryViewModel.cs file to change the initial value of the Quantity variable from 3 to 12. Additionally, two new properties, Unit_Calorie and Total_Calorie, were added to the FoodItem model. Commented out lines in FoodCatagoryPage.xaml potentially suggest a future update. Lastly, these changes ensure that data bindings remain consistent across different files.

Update calorie computations and bindings
Calorie calculations have been updated to show total rather than unit calories. This is done by adding the "Total_Calories" property which is bound in the view instead of just "Calories". Also, "Unit_Calorie" has been introduced in the food item model for computation. Changes are reflected on "AddedFoodItem" and "FoodCategory" view and view model.

Add hardcoded CategoryID parameter to ViewFoodItemPage navigation
FoodItem.xaml.cs is updated to include an additional hardcoded parameter (10) for CategoryID in the ViewFoodItemPage navigation method call. The change is made in the ViewFoodItem_Tapped method. This modification maintains the same function signature as before but with an extra argument.

Add categoryId persistence in FoodCategoryViewModel
The categoryId string was added in the FoodCategoryViewModel class. This addition ensures categoryId is consistently tracked not only at the moment of instantiation but also throughout the lifecycle of the FoodCategoryViewModel instance. This will particularly handle scenarios where GetCategoryNumber

Add database loading method to App.xaml.cs
A new method, LoadDatabase, has been added to App.xaml.cs. This method initializes and returns a new DatabaseManager instance, preparing it for usage. The code also includes additional required namespaces at the beginning of the file.

Refactor handling of categoryId in FoodCategoryViewModel
The logic of setting the `categoryId` in FoodCategoryViewModel has been updated to use Xamarin Essential preferences. This reduces code duplication and leverages the more robust built-in data-storage mechanism. In related changes, the usage of `categoryId` in ViewFoodItemPage.xaml.cs was replaced with Xamarin Essential preferences for consistency and reliability.

Implement user authentication token storage
Added functionality for storing and retrieving user's authentication token in "CreateAccountViewModel" and "LoginViewModel". This facilitates auto-login if the stored token is found, thus improving application usability and reducing the need for repetitive log-ins.

Disable back button and navigation bar in all pages
The mentioned changes have been implemented across all pages. In addition, the logout process was enhanced by clearing the AuthToken and navigating the user back to the login page when the button is clicked on the AccountSettingsPage.

Add back button functionality and hide navigation bar
The changes implemented in this commit include the addition of a back button function to all pages, as well as hiding the navigation bar on specific pages. Both of these changes aim to provide a more seamless navigation experience within the application.

Add Newtonsoft.Json package and create FoodDatabaseManager
The Newtonsoft.Json package has been added to the project. This allows for use in the newly added FoodDatabaseManager class, which is required for fetching product data for the food database by using API calls. Also, correspondent updates were made in the views and Models/Product.cs files had been added to represent Product class.

Remove FoodDatabaseManager and Product classes
The FoodDatabaseManager and Product classes in the Models folder of the SeniorProjectHealthApplication have been deleted. This is probably due to changes in the structure of the project or the implementation of functionalities that rendered these classes redundant or obsolete.

Update Android project settings and implement food product api
This commit updates the Android project settings to support different ABIs and sets the HTTP client handler. Along with these changes, the FoodCategoryViewModel has been modified. It is now capable of fetching food product data from an external API and adding this product to the food list. A new project folder, Packages, has also been added.

Add fetching and console printing for raw chicken breast
In the FoodCategoryViewModel, a fetch operation for "raw chicken breast" product was added. Additionally, the page count of the fetched responses is now getting printed in the console for easier debugging and tracking.

Update food item data and include OpenFoodFacts package
In this commit, the fetching parameters in FoodCategoryViewModel have been updated for more accurate results. Also, the OpenFoodFacts-CSharp.csproj package is newly referenced in the project. Now, it fetches data with a different product code ("01289903" instead of "034856890089") and searches for "chicken" rather than "raw chicken breast". This could give better search results for users looking for food items or recipes.

Add OpenFoodFacts API handler & related models
Include API handler for OpenFoodFacts to access nutritional information and the related models including ingredients, packaging, nutrition facts, etc. This will enable the application to fetch detailed health and nutritional information for different foods.

Add search functionality and remove food item feature
Implemented a search functionality in the AddFoodPage ViewModel by creating a new SearchCommand. Designed the behavior and binding for the search entry in the XAML page. Moreover, added a feature to remove a specific food item from the list. The remove button click event was handled accordingly to execute the newly defined RemoveFoodItem method in FoodCategory ViewModel, to manage database interactions for the deletion operation.

Update search functionality and refactor bindings in AddFood layout
The update includes changes in event handling from "TextChanged" to "Completed" in the SearchCommand. Also, 'FoodName' and 'Calories' bindings were refactored to 'Food_Name' and 'Total_Calories' respectively. New code to search for foods by name was added to the AddFoodPageViewModel. The layout for displaying the search results was also improved with the implementation of a CollectionView. A new FoodDatabaseManager class was also created to manage food data requests.

Update navigation and error handling in food application
The GoBack_Clicked function in AddFoodPage.xaml.cs now pops the stack instead of navigating to a new FoodCategoryPage. In addition, the AddFoodPageViewModel.cs now handles the case where no products are found, by displaying a "No food found..." message. Lastly, the OpenFoodFactsApiLowLevelClient.cs no longer throws an exception when a product's fetch by code fails, but instead returns null.

Refactor code to improve readability and remove redundancies
Code has been cleaned up to remove unnecessary line breaks, improve consistency with single-line assignments, and remove redundant namespace imports. Additionally, some direct references to classes have been replaced with var keyword for increased readability. These revisions adhere to best practices for C# syntax, enhancing code elegance without modifying functionality.

Add fallback query for barcode when no food is found
The changes ensure that the query for a product by barcode is performed when the initial search yields no food items. This serves as a fallback mechanism to ensure that the search provides some result even when the primary query fails to do so. The barcode query has been hardcoded with a specific ID for now.

Update food item tracking and nutrition calculation methods
Added functionality to track and update food items more accurately by utilizing the barcode information. Updated the nutrition calculation method to reflect changes in quantity. Extended the FoodItem model to store additional product data and link it with the OpenFoodFacts API.

Add foodItem update and additional properties in models and views
A 'UpdateFoodItem' method has been added to 'DatabaseManager.cs' for updating specific food items based on quantity changes. Additional properties like 'FoodItemJson' and 'ProductInformation' have been integrated into models and views, including 'FoodItem.cs', 'AddedFoodItem.xaml.cs', 'ViewFoodItemPage.xaml.cs' etc., enhancing identification of food items and their information. This also includes changes in navigation parameters in page transitions and updates in ViewModel logic.

Add .gitignore and library configurations
Added a .gitignore file for the SeniorProjectHealthApplication's .idea folder and established configurations for multiple androidx libraries. These changes ensure that unnecessary files are not tracked and the required libraries are appropriately set up.

Add delete functionality to food items
Added a DeleteItem function to the DatabaseManager. This aligns with interactive functionality on the UI where a delete button is included on the AddedFoodItem page for food items. A corresponding bindable property, "FI_ID", is also created to facilitate the food item identification and deletion.

Add database loading and WebView to OpenWorkoutViewModel
This commit introduces the loading of an ExerciseDatabase instance within the OpenWorkoutViewModel. It also replaces the ExecuteOpenWorkout method with a WebView that makes use of workout data from the database. The OpenWorkoutViewModel is now being bound as the context in WorkoutScreenPage.

Add Discord project settings
A new XML file named discord.xml has been added to the .idea directory. This file includes Discord project settings for the SeniorProjectHealthApplication, with a setup for showing project files and an empty description spot.

Update exercise database ids and command parameters
The changes primarily involve updating various exercise items in the database, specifically incrementing exercise database ids. Additionally, the `CommandParameter` in 'Bodyweight_Intermediate.xaml' was incremented for better synchronization and data consistency.

Add weight goal selection and macro nutrient sliders
This commit adds a weight goal selection dropdown to the GoalsStartPage, along with sliders to adjust the ratio of macronutrients in the user's diet. Some methods were also improved or added to handle these new features, providing a more dynamic user experience. Additionally, fixed default user id in the UserDataManager model.

Updated workout views and navigation
Updated various workout views to include back navigation and altered clickable items to ImageButton from Image for enhanced functionality. Also, eliminated superfluous code and restructured certain objects for better readability and maintainability of code. Additionally, fixes were applied to the navigation hierarchy to improve application flow.

These revisions adhere to best practices for C# syntax, enhancing code elegance without modifying functionality.

Add Discord project settings
A new XML file named discord.xml has been added to the .idea directory. This file includes Discord project settings for the SeniorProjectHealthApplication, with a setup for showing project files and an empty description spot.

Update exercise database ids and command parameters
The changes primarily involve updating various exercise items in the database, specifically incrementing exercise database ids. Additionally, the `CommandParameter` in 'Bodyweight_Intermediate.xaml' was incremented for better synchronization and data consistency.

Update weight loss calculation and add goal saving button
The weight loss calculation now reflects the number of days instead of weeks and it is displayed in a more understandable date format. Additionally, a "Save Goal" button has been added to GoalsStartPage.xaml. Few changes to variable names and userId for debugging purposes are also included in this commit.

Add weight goal selection and macro nutrient sliders
This commit adds a weight goal selection dropdown to the GoalsStartPage, along with sliders to adjust the ratio of macronutrients in the user's diet. Some methods were also improved or added to handle these new features, providing a more dynamic user experience. Additionally, fixed default user id in the UserDataManager model.

Update UI and navigation for workout screen
Updated UI of workout screen and navigation controls. Disabled back button and navigation bar on multiple pages. Refactored buttons to initiate navigation, and updated related event handlers. Added new view models to several pages.

Updated workout views and navigation
Updated various workout views to include back navigation and altered clickable items to ImageButton from Image for enhanced functionality. Also, eliminated superfluous code and restructured certain objects for better readability and maintainability of code. Additionally, fixes were applied to the navigation hierarchy to improve application flow.
